storyInfo: With the Legions providing cover, the Abyssal Hunters penetrate into the nest to plant the final beacon. Ulpianus continues his search for the truth, while the Doctor finds Consul Clementia and grills her on Ægir's plans for the Hunters.

attributes.content: Ugh, what a stench.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: All these years and they still won't make better camouflage cream—it wouldn't do any harm for us to at least smell different from the Seaborn, you know.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Don't move so much, Shark. It'll only make the smell stronger.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: When you smell this much like a Seaborn, I might hack at you on instinct.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The whole plateau is trembling... Those giant wormlike Seaborn are tunneling through the rock beneath us.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Stay concealed.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: (Vacuole lightly trembles)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Core shudders fiercely)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Look at those numbers. Honestly, between the currents and the Seaborn, who's carrying who?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: They're flooding towards the frontline. I can't imagine...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Can't imagine what the soldiers there are fighting through.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Snap out of it, Skadi. You'll crush your hilt doing that.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We mourn those on the front best by completing our mission.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Thanks to the Legions' fleets containing the Seaborn swarm, we were able to slip in and plant this beacon deep in the nest.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Even a single plant could alert the Seaborn to us, if it happens to be assimilated. There is no room for negligence on our path forward.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The great bleached coral will cover us as we dive for the depths of the rift.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Yes, Captain.
attributes.name: Specter & Skadi

attributes.content: Jordi, right? Fast learner.
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: A lot of students come here on work experience. With all the operation protocol, it never takes more than a day for them to slip up. You, though, picked it up just by watching for a little while.
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: You done this before?
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: Just a bit. I've done some work in an Iberian lighthouse. The beacons share a few principles with it, here and there.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I see, so you're into engineering. Explains a lot.
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: I've worked longest as a caregiver, though.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: 'Caregiver'? What kind of job's that?
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Ah, er, watching over the sick and elderly, taking care of their daily needs... Sorting out all the little things for them.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Gotcha. So it's like slapping Little Handy modules 153 and 274 in at the same time.
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: Um, but the Little Handy is impersonal... right?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That's correct.
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: You look taut as a wire, Jordi. This isn't an exam on Ægir general knowledge.
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: I just want to ask... if the Little Handy has no personality, how is it supposed to meet the emotional needs of its patients?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: To care for people is to meet them in their weakest, most vulnerable moments, after all.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I'd say physical frailty doesn't particularly inspire emotional needs in us. And if we're headed for the grave, even with illness, we don't feel especially vulnerable, either.
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: We do let the old and sick request some final company before their euthanasia, though. Usually a leading philosopher will come in. Scholars from whatever field in general, really.
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: I-I know nothing about philosophy...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I just talk to them about the most banal things. Food, flowers, sunshine, and so on. But for some reason, they're always so happy to listen.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You're a great guy, Jordi.
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: That shows how keen you are at grasping people's moods. No promises, but something tells me you'd shine in the Institute of Development Planning or Institute of Incubation too.
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: C-Could I?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: ...Regardless, thank you so much! I've finished resetting the storage facilities here!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Wonderful work. Now, about—
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: Wait. Did you just see something zip past the hologram?
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: Wha—
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: INTRUDER—
attributes.name: Beacon Tower Technician

attributes.content: You?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Young man, you saw none of this. You have no reason to complicate things.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Wait!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Shark's saw will be too loud. Skadi, you open the way.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Cut through this cluster, as quietly as you can.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: For but an instant, the invading Hunters are bathed in vivid color and indistinct light.
That which the Iberians call nethersea brand creeps across the coral layers, the spawn of the many lilting in their craggy nests.
Eggs are swept from this cliff face as the currents pass, metamorphosing as they spiral down, indescribable folds yet unfolding, until a Seaborn form emerges.
(Soft membrane stirs)
attributes.name: Nascent Seaborn

attributes.content: (Creased skin shudders)
attributes.name: Nascent Seaborn

attributes.content: The newborns silently gather together, their trembling bodies echoing all throughout the nest. Intertwining palps and feelers, they sweep each other off for far away.
They just keep on leaving the nest. Rushing... for the frontline.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Wait, don't you think something's off? How did that one turn into a whole bunch out of nowhere?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What is it doing? Multiplying? Splitting?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I've had this gnawing feeling ever since we bailed out the fleet. Swordfish, have these assholes evolved even more?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: The Seaborn are forever evolving.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Skadi, can you remember the first Seaborn you ever killed?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Not really. Just that it had a lot of gross tentacles.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: That's what I mean. Tentacles, stingers, chitinous shells... We could still discern the organs, identify their functions at a glance.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Prior to this, the Seaborn's only skill was to hijack whatever evolutionary progress other species had accrued over the epochs.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: But now we've got these things...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: I can't begin to tell what their organs are. If I didn't know better, I might not even think to connect them to the fodder we were slaughtering just three months ago.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: ...The Seaborn's needs have outgrown the evolutionary advancements. They've begun seeking their own answers.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Which means their evolutionary course now transcends our knowledge.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: If we are unable to gloss their physical composition, unable to discern their organs' unique functions, unable to predict the direction they will evolve...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: We won't know how to kill them.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: We could fetch a specimen for Advisor Blandus, while we evacuate.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Still, the mission takes priority for now.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Skadi, you and I will find where the wall hasn't yet been branded, embed the beacon there, and activate it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Laurentina, spot our surroundings. We withdraw as soon as it's planted, without delay.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Greetings, Doctor of Rhodes Island, and well met in Milliarium. At long last, our first official conversation.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.options: Well, Kal'tsit's the official Iberian envoy.

attributes.content: Save your modesty. Dr. Kal'tsit's awe-inspiring knowledge transcends the boundaries of space and time.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: So for her to be keeping you up her sleeve, the depths you hide must be deeper still.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Whether you come to me in doubt, or with conclusions of your own to share, I am prepared to listen.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.options: You sent the Hunters into a literal nest of danger.;You're endangering three of our operators.

attributes.content: Much like Dr. Kal'tsit, you have misgivings about this decision.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Yet I had no choice but to order them to meet death in the eye once more; my hand was forced. Only they can break our present impasse.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.options: Rational. Maybe a little too rational?

attributes.content: The Legions are deployed to capacity. The Abyssal Hunters must assume combat duties, even having recently returned to Ægir. You suspect this situation was deliberately engineered.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: I gather you return from the city with findings of your own.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.options: The beacon-weapon link was tampered with.

attributes.content: Little Handy, priority order. Contact the supervisors for the beacon and Class IV weapons R&D.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: And notify all Legion commanders: leave enough of your fleets at the front to curb the Seaborn and assist the Hunters. The rest should withdraw in order and return to the city. The Sea Patrol will seize the beacon tower right away.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: You have our gratitude for informing us, Doctor.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: I know I owe the two of you an explanation for how I have deployed the Abyssal Hunters.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: We don't hold you accountable on a tactical level. You know their prowess against the Seaborn better than us.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I can only say this. Your powers of observation would not have missed the scales on Gladiia's neck.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We can assume the Hunters will have no trouble seeing this assignment through, but what was your guarantee they would be spared from mutating while in the nest?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The word of Advisor Blandus, and nothing more?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Advisor Blandus's statement at the tribunal served to strengthen Milliarium's confidence in the Abyssal Hunters.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: I confess, though, it failed to even ease my mind.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: I take it the Hunters still weigh heavily on your thoughts.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Ægir never truly wound down the Abyssal Hunter project, following the strike on the Firstborn.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: I've not been involved, but my countrymen have every right to interrogate me for my awareness of it alone.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: For a short time after the Firstborn died, the project went through major upheavals. Anomalies plagued the experiments, and the Church grew only more fixated on the Hunters.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: This suggests there are urgent, hidden truths about the Hunters yet to be found. Yet it also proves that the project can no longer run publicly.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: To this day, it still operates in secret. But even now, Ægir has only three Hunters including Gladiia... No, four.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: For how constantly we iterate on our technology, we have never succeeded in making another Abyssal Hunter.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: No matter how stable the subjects' signs and psychological indicators are, they lose their reason the moment they awaken, immediately corrupting into Seaborn.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: They don't even make it out of the chamber, let alone to the ocean proper.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.options: 'Abyssal Hunters are bound by blood.' We forgot...
What IS this blood binding them?

attributes.content: We don't know.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: We still don't know why Gladiia's group have kept their reason intact.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.options: Sounds like they're your key to solving this.
Yet you chose to send them to the front.

attributes.content: ...Indeed. For Gladiia, Laurentina, Skadi, and all the participants, it was an irresponsible act.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: But the front lies at Milliarium now.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: We made it in time to cut off the Seaborn tide as it laps at dry land, but Milliarium is far from impregnable. If we fail to open the Waterway now, it is only a matter of time before the city is lost.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: The Seaborn have organized to seize that Waterway by the throat. Storming them head-on will invite a large-scale counterattack.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: At which point, I fear none will survive.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.options: Is risking the Hunters a necessary cost here?

attributes.content: The Hunters may well give their lives. They may well transform. But right now, they are our greatest hope.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Gladiia has always been skeptical of the Waterway Program's feasibility. It was for that exact reason that she did not hesitate to serve as a link in its chain.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Your doubts and struggles may differ, but all roads lead to the same place in the end. That seems to be an unspoken yet shared understanding among the Ægir.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...One not without its sorrows.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Upon the bricks of the Sophontheatrum entrance, the architect Mártus left this maxim: 'There is no justice here, only the path ahead.'
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: In later generations, some criticized Mártus as being overly fixated on material value, squandering his energy on comparing worth against worth.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: But ultimately, all that mattered to him was Ægir's path forward. Justice was merely a value cherished by the masses; and he preferred to apply his thought elsewhere.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Perhaps Gladiia and I have been acting on his philosophy without realizing it.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit, everything you have said rings all too true. I am bound in the end to carry 'Ægir's arrogance' with me, and nothing will change that.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: I would like to amend that wording. 'Arrogance' as a word seems insufficient to describe Ægir.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You respect equally the humanity of your every citizen. To realize each individual's worth is the guiding star for your entire society's development.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yet at the same time, you are capable of making the cruelest judgments, and calmly accepting them, for the sake of Ægir's survival as a whole.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: 'Calmly'... you say?
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: We Ægir are not cold-blooded. Whenever you would feel wrath, our own hearts are far from unstirring.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: These are feelings I had wished to convey to Gladiia, once upon a time, but I realized I had no right to.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Every decision I made for her, I based in pure rationality. How natural, then, that I lost that right. How dare I ask for an emotional pardon.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: The same is true, even now.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: And so, 'calmly,' I accept my own judgment.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: The designated individual has been contacted. Advisor Blandus did not pick up.
attributes.name: 'Little Handy'

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit, Doctor. I am deeply sorry I could not give you an appropriate answer.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: But right now, I ask that you permit me to carry out my duty.
attributes.name: Clementia
